sentence.Network_en: Impure drinking water is a cause of disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 不洁的饮用水是引发疾病的一个原因.

sentence.Network_en: Impure novels have brought and are bringing much misery on the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 不洁的小说已经给世界带来不幸,还将带来更多的不幸.

sentence.Network_en: The air of a big city is often impure.
sentence.Network_cn: 大城市的空气往往是污浊的.

替位式杂质原子(impurity atom)是杂质原子代替基本原子的位置。 能吸收光的点缺陷称为色心。 Solid State Physics Physics Department, Northwest University 线缺陷.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'dirty, containing offensive matter'): from Latin impurus, from in- 'not' + purus 'pure'

entry.def: A substance that is impure is not of good quality because it has other substances mixed with it.
If you describe thoughts and actions as impure, you mean they are concerned with sex and are morally bad.

means.word_mean: 2. used of persons or behaviors; not morally pure;

auth_sentence.content: Bentonite is an absorbent aluminum phyllosilicate generally impure clay consisting mostly of montmorillonite.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Bentonite is an absorbent aluminum phyllosilicate generally impure clay consisting mostly of montmorillonite.

auth_sentence.content: Sounding exasperated, he says, yes, a few are having impure thoughts.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sounding exasperated, he says, yes, a few are having impure thoughts.

pur纯洁+itan→n.清教徒 adj.清教徒的
pur纯洁+ity表名词→n.纯净;纯洁;纯度
